Comments_List: Scientific writing and the ability to think critically and analyze a paper.
This course developed my ability to read and be critical of literature. Additionally, the course honed my ability to write critically about literature.

The papers are very well-chosen and the teachers are very good at instruct us through the papers and inspire us to think. I like this course!

However, I also have one suggestion for the course. It would be great if we could receive feedback about our synopsis. I actually spent a lot of time in it and regard it as a good chance to improve my writing. Thus I am really looking forward to receiving suggestions about it!

The course was a more successful than the class series in teaching specific concepts and better describing the nuances and applications of the topics taught in class. 

With different lecturers, each class was different. The more successful ones were those that delved into the papers and the discussions that branched from that. Those that re-lectured material were not as engaging. Additionally, those that felt like they were rushing to go through the material made the class time shorter.
Yes, I strongly recommend this course to those interested in cell biology, especially the first-year students!
Yes, this course was good reenforcement for the material covered in class. Additionally, it allowed for a smaller group to discuss topics with lecturers.
